title: Job Vacancies at NEVADA Restaurant and Lounge
content:
NEVADA Restaurant and Lounge offers exquisite dining, chic lounge, live music & events and signature Cocktails.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Mixologist

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Prepare and serve a wide range of cocktails, mocktails, and other beverages.
	Ensure the bar area is well-stocked, organized, and clean.
	Deliver exceptional customer service and maintain a lively bar atmosphere.
	Suggest innovative drink recipes and seasonal menu ideas.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Mixologist or Bartender.
	Excellent knowledge of cocktails, wines, and bar operations.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Must be creative, punctual, and customer-focused.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and application letter to: hr1nevada@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email or deliver in person to the restaurant.

 

 

2.) Grill Chef

Job Location: Port Harcourt, GRA, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a skilled and passionate Grill Chef to join our culinary team.
	The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with grilling techniques, preparing high-quality dishes, and maintaining food safety standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and grill meats, poultry, seafood, and vegetables to perfection.
	Develop and present creative grill menu options.
	Ensure food quality, taste, and presentation meet company standards.
	Maintain a clean, safe, and organized workstation at all times.
	Monitor stock levels and communicate supply needs.
	Adhere to all food hygiene and safety regulations.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Grill Chef, Cook, or in a similar role.
	Knowledge of different grilling methods and seasonings.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
	Team player with excellent communication skills.
	Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, and holidays.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and benefits.
	Opportunities for growth and skill development.
	A dynamic and supportive work environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: hr1nevada@gmail.com using “Application – Grill Chef” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Chef

Job Location: Port Harcourt, GRA, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking to employ a professional Chef to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for planning, preparing, and delivering high-quality meals while maintaining the highest standards of hygiene, creativity, and consistency.


Responsibilities


	Plan and prepare a wide variety of meals and menus.
	Ensure proper presentation and portioning of all dishes.
	Maintain kitchen hygiene and compliance with food safety standards.
	Monitor inventory, manage kitchen supplies, and minimize wastage.
	Supervise and train kitchen staff when required.
	Incorporate creativity and innovation into recipes and food presentation.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Chef in a reputable organization.
	Strong knowledge of various cuisines and modern cooking techniques.
	Ability to manage time, pressure, and multitasking effectively.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and teamwork skills.
	A relevant culinary certification is an added advantage.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief cover letter to: hr1nevada@gmail.com using “Application for Chef Position” as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

title: Job Vacancies at Nina Jojer Limited
content:
Nina Jojer Limited is a Pan-African consulting firm committed to empowering transformation in Africa by providing innovative solutions to businesses, governments, and organizations. Our core services include provision of HR solutions, Policy Development, Strategic Advisory, Stakeholder Management and Advocacy, Digital Transformation, and Data-Driven Insights. We are dedicated to driving impact and fostering long-term growth for our clients.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Consultant Engineer

Job Locations: Enugu, Jigawa, Kaduna and Katsina
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	UNICEF in collaboration with government authorities and FCDO in Nigeria has developed an innovative project ‘Climate Resilient Infrastructure for Basic Services’ (CRIBS) that aims to scale a model for assessing climate risks and vulnerabilities of primary healthcare facilities (PHCs) and primary schools and subsequently identifying and implementing interventions to make those facilities more resilient.
	The second phase of the CRIBS project (CRIBS II, 2025-2026) is being implemented in Bauchi, Enugu, Gombe, Jigawa, Kaduna, and Katsina states in Nigeria. Hence, the need to mobilize a team of 40 Engineers for the task.


Job Details
Main Responsibilities and Tasks:
The responsibilities and key assignments for this consultancy in relation to the CRIBS Phase II Project are as follows:


	Undertaking detailed survey of PHCs and schools identified by CRIBS project for climate resilient interventions
	Preparing designs and BOQs for the PHCs and school facilities surveyed
	Undertake construction supervision of the work implemented by contractors
	Certify and valuate the construction work completed by construction contractors
	Undertake any other work assigned by the supervisors.


Deliverables


	Each Engineer is responsible for the following deliverables. However, UNICEF may prepare twenty groups of two Engineers for engineering survey and supervision of each facility.
	Collectively the 40 Engineers will be responsible for survey, design and BOQ preparation for about 200 facilities, and manage site supervision of an estimated 160 facilities. In average each Engineer will be responsible for following deliverables:
	
		10 facilities (PHCs and Schools) detailed survey completed, and survey report including GPS coordinates, photographs, and
		submitted in a format provided by UNICEF
		10 facilities BOQ prepared in the template provided by UNICEF with quality standards and drawings
		Construction supervision of 10 facilities carried out for the facilities (PHCs and Schools) assigned to him/her through daily/weekly visit to facilities as agreed with the supervisor
		Progress status of construction work of assigned PHCs and Schools updated every week with photographs
	
	
	All the above-mentioned reports are to be submitted on time to the WASH Specialist of Kaduna, Bauchi, Kano, and Enugu Field Offices.


Requirements
Work Experience and Key Competencies:


	Interested candidates should possess a B.Eng Degree
	A minimum of three years of professional experience in the civil engineering construction field is required.
	Experience in managing PHCs and School construction/rehabilitation projects would have added advantages.
	Experience in community dialogue, ability to work at the community level, and ability to speak the local language.
	Teamwork and negotiation skills on project development issues at the community level.
	Excellent presentation skills, both in terms of written and oral communication.
	Willingness to travel to rural and semi-urban areas of the state/country.
	IT skills with the ability to generate data, interpret, and utilize it for planning
	Ability to work effectively with LGAs and local leaders.


Language:


	Excellent communication and writing skills in English.
	Knowledge of Local language (Enugu/Hausa).


Application Closing Date: 30th October, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers.ninajojer@gmail.com using the Job Posiiton and Location as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Project Assistant (ICT Standardization)

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Project Assistant (ICT Standardization) will provide technical, administrative, and coordination support in the planning, implementation, and monitoring of ICT standardization projects and initiatives.
	The role will assist in facilitating stakeholder engagements and preparing technical documentation.


Main Responsibilities and Tasks
Project Coordination and Support:


	Assist in the day-to-day management and coordination of ICT standardization projects and activities.
	Support the preparation and updating of project work plans, schedules, and progress reports.
	Track project milestones, deliverables, and timelines to ensure compliance with agreed targets.
	Coordinate logistics for project meetings, workshops, and technical committee sessions.


Technical and Research Support:


	Assist in drafting technical reports, policy briefs, and discussion papers related to ICT standardization.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	Prepare minutes, follow-up actions, and summaries of stakeholder consultations and technical committee meetings.


Administrative and Logistical Support:


	Manage project documentation, correspondence, and filing systems.
	Assist in the preparation of procurement requests, budget tracking, and financial documentation as required.
	Provide logistical support for capacity-building programs, conferences, and standardization fora.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Project Management, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience in ICT projects, standardization, or quality assurance.
	Experience working with public institutions, standardization bodies, or international development organizations is desirable.


Technical Skills:


	Good understanding of ICT standardization processes, frameworks, and emerging technologies.
	Strong research, analytical, and report-writing skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and project management tools.
	Familiarity with international/national standards bodies such as ISO, IEC, ITU, or IEEE is an asset.


Application Closing Date: 28th October, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers.ninajojer@gmail.com using the Job Positoin and Location as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Education State Facilitator

Job Locations: Bauchi & Gombe
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Bauchi Field Office Education team is supporting the State Governments in the implementation of the education interventions and Climate Resilient Infrastructure for Basic Services (CRIBS) that aims to scale a model for assessin climate risks and vulnerabilities of primary schools and subsequently identifying and implementing interventions to make those schools more resilient.
	The partnership with the government is to support Bauchi and Gombe States to increase access to learning opportunities, improve enrollment, and ensure active participation and completion of quality primary education by all children,particularly children with disabilities (CwDs), girls, and adolescents.
	It aims to complement the efforts of the government and those of its development partners to address effectively and substantially reduce the number of OOSCs through improved access, quality learning, and system strengthening.
	The education team in Bauchi FO comprises only two staff members. Given the demands and increased scope of work, the Education section is proposing to hire two State facilitators to support the monitoring and delivery of the programme.
	The engagement of the State Facilitator will support and ensure effective coordination and monitoring of the implementation of all activities under the CRIBS and Education interventions.
	The State Facilitator will be responsible for real-time monitoring, data collection, reporting, sharing feedback on program implementation, and ensuring resources are utilized judiciously for intended purposes.
	He/She will consolidate the reports, track progress, provide technical guidance, deploy knowledge and experience to create momentum at the state, LGAs, communities, and school levels in quality and timelyimplementation, and ensure the sustainability of education programs.


Main Responsibilities & Tasks


	Support the planning and implementation of the Climate Infrastructure for Basic Service (CRIBS) project in schools in collaboration with the State Universal Basic Education Boards (SUBEB), State Ministries of Education (SMoE), State Agency for Mass Education, and Local Education Authority.
	Support planning and implementation of the Bauchi Field Office Education workplan, and other education activities at the State and LGA level in collaboration with the State Universal Basic Education Boards (SUBEB), State Ministries of Education (SMoE), State Agency for Mass Education, and Local Education Authority.
	Support the States with the digital systems/platforms – EMIS- following up on data collection, reporting system glitches
	Collaborate with state ministries, local governments, and implementing partners to ensure program alignment with national and state education priorities.
	Monitor the School-Based Management Committee work in the targeted LGA in collaboration with SUBEB Support implementation and monitoring of Blended learning in formal and non-formal centers using the Nigeria Learning Passport
	Conduct classroom observation of teachers’ application of teaching techniques/skills learned from training and maintain a database on key education targets using tools provided by the UNICEF Education section.
	In collaboration with government partners and UNICEF, monitoring the implementation of the FLN across the intervention schools
	Support learning assessment capacity building for State Officials
	Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including state, local governments, communities, and civil society organizations (CSOs)
	Regularly communicate with UNICEF Field Office education staff responsible for the activities and discuss issues of concern on the implementation of projects.
	Provide monthly progress reports on the status of the project activities and support the documentation of best practices and lessons learned from implementation.
	Any other duties assigned by the Education Specialist


Deliverables:


	Monthly work plan detailing how key tasks will be conducted in monitoring the CRIPBS interventions
	Monthly progress report detailing achievement, best practices, and lessons learnt from CRIBS and general education interventions
	Timely submission of bi-weekly, monthly, and quarterly activity progress reports and emerging reports on specific interventions
	Daily update on the progress within the assigned state with respect to the CRIBS and Education investment
	The facilitator is to spend 60% on the field for monitoring and supportive supervision
	Human-Interest Stories and Picture Stories
	Monthly analysis of teachers' monitoring report


Requirements
Education:


	A first Degree in education, social sciences, economics, or related fields
	Computer Literate


Language:


	Fluency in the English language and good English writing skills. Fluency in
	written and spoken Hausa, the language of the immediate environment
	where the Facilitator is deployed.


Work Experience:


	At least 5 years of experience and demonstrated ability in supporting
	capacity development work in education.
	Experience working on gender issues and extensive knowledge and skills in
	education and social sectors in Nigeria preferably in northern Nigeria.
	Experience working in a humanitarian and development context is an asset.
	Skills in the use of Microsoft Office suites are a must.
	Experience working with UN or NGO programs/projects is an asset


Application Closing Date: 5th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers.ninajojer@gmail.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Manager",
  "description": "Mactay Consulting&nbsp;is&nbsp;the leading management consulting firm in Nigeria, providing HR Consulting, Learning &amp; Development Solutions, Outsourcing and Contact Centre Solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type:&nbsp;Full-Time
Department:&nbsp;Sales &amp; Business Growth
Reports To:&nbsp;Managing Director

Position Overview


	The Business Development Manager (BDM) will be responsible for driving the commercial growth of the organization, a leading player in the manufacturing sector engaged in the production and distribution of PVC pipes and fittings, electrical cables, lubricants, plastic products, and other related industrial goods.
	The BDM will lead strategic initiatives aimed at expanding market share, developing new sales channels, and strengthening customer relationships. The ideal candidate should be a strategic thinker with solid experience in industrial and B2B sales.


Key Responsibilities
Market Development &amp; Expansion:


	Identify and develop new business opportunities across existing and untapped markets in Nigeria and West Africa.
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis to guide pricing, product positioning, and marketing strategy.
	Establish partnerships with distributors, wholesalers, and key accounts in the construction, electrical, and industrial sectors.
